com.b2international.snowowl.core.exceptions

Class ApiException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • com.b2international.commons.exceptions.FormattedRuntimeException
            • com.b2international.snowowl.core.exceptions.ApiException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BadRequestException, ConflictException, NotFoundException, NotImplementedException

    public abstract class ApiException
extends FormattedRuntimeException
    Represents a high-level API call exception. This exception should be thrown in all cases when a service would like to indicate problems with the request/event itself or with the processing of the request/event.
    Since:
    4.1
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • toApiError

        public final ApiError toApiError()
        Creates an ApiError representation from this exception. Useful when the exception must be propagated through protocols where Java serialization cannot be used (eg. HTTP), or the possible receiver cannot understand serialized Java class and object byte sequences.
        Returns:
        ApiError representation of this ApiException, never null.

      • getCode

        protected java.lang.Integer getCode()
        Returns the custom application specific code for ApiError conversion. Subclasses may override.
        Returns:

      • getDeveloperMessage

        protected java.lang.String getDeveloperMessage()
        Returns the developer message associated with this exception. Subclasses may override.
        Returns:

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getAdditionalInfo()
        Returns additional information about the ApiException.
        Returns:
